summary: Email correspondence between attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein in custody. The emails discuss requests for preservation of evidence related to Epstein's detention and death, ongoing investigations, and legal procedures. The chain includes a detailed preservation request from Epstein's family attorney to the government.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Sends detailed request for preservation of all evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's detention and death to federal prosecutors. Represents Epstein's family.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Recipient of emails regarding Epstein's death and evidence preservation. Appears to be legal counsel involved in the case.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Recipient of emails regarding Epstein's death and evidence preservation. Appears to be legal counsel involved in the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the correspondence. Died in custody on August 10, 2019. His detention, attempted suicide on July 23, 2019, and death are the focus of evidence preservation requests.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having personal counsel who should receive identical preservation requests from Martin Weinberg.

connections.description: Weinberg is acting as attorney for Epstein's family, making legal requests regarding evidence preservation after Epstein's death.
Weinberg communicates with Miller regarding legal matters concerning Epstein's death and evidence preservation.
Weinberg communicates with Weingarten regarding legal matters concerning Epstein's death and evidence preservation.
Both are recipients of the same legal communications regarding Epstein's death and appear to be working on related legal matters.

events.title: Epstein's imprisonment begins
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein begins his detention/imprisonment according to the preservation request.

events.title: Epstein's attempted suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was involved in an occurrence investigated as an attempted suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Night before Epstein's death
events.description: The evening before Epstein's death, referenced for video preservation requests of the 9th floor area near his cell.

events.title: Epstein's death in custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Multiple investigations were initiated including by the FBI and Attorney General.

locations: 9th floor unit (MCC SHU unit where Epstein was incarcerated)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in custody on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Epstein had a previous incident on July 23, 2019, that was investigated as an attempted suicide.

Epstein's family attorney made a comprehensive request for preservation of all evidence related to Epstein's detention and death, including videos, logs, medical records, and any notes found in his cell.
Multiple investigations were initiated following Epstein's death, including by the FBI and at the direction of the Attorney General.
The correspondence reveals ongoing legal communication between Epstein's family attorneys and federal prosecutors regarding evidence preservation and investigation updates.
